intro: Justicia praecox, commonly known as the early justicia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is lance-shaped and often has a slightly hairy texture. Justicia praecox is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
